sub_title: Researcher || Process Electrification || Chemical Reactor Engineering
summary:
Chemical engineering researcher with 4+ years experience of working in RD&I organization for supporting various businesses in process technology-related challenges with my modelling and experimentation skills. Expertise in developing CO2 neutral-sustainable processes and equipment, leading to enhanced energy and eco-efficiency. Extensive experience in the design and development of (multiphase) reactors and associated processes by applying fundamentals of process intensification. I am a quick learner, persistent, a hard worker, and a team player. 

Currently working as Researcher Process Technology at Nouryon and being a part of central expert's pool to support multiple business areas of Nouryon on a wide range of topics, including; 
•  Process digitalization (IC4.0): Automated Data Reconciliation and MASC using VBA, Python, ACM software
•  Process and unit operation modelling and optimization: Developing custom process models in ACM, ASPEN+ 
•  Development of new technologies and sustainable processes: Water electrolysis, Green chemicals 
•  Kinetic/catalytic studies: Building experimental set-up(s) and experimental investigation for a range of processes
•  Acting as a research project leader   

During my PhD, I have developed a non-thermal (catalytic) plasma reactor for nitrogen oxides and ammonia production, which included designing and building a complete pilot-scale process followed by a thorough experimental investigation. 
•  Published >12 research papers and 2 book chapters in highly rated journals. 
•  This work paved the path to secure research grants to the tune of ~18 MEuro and to establish a plasma sub-group. 
•  Moreover, successfully supervised: MSc Theses (02), BSc Thesis (01), and BSc project students (13).

While working in my current role, as PDEng and PhD, I have developed innovative and energy-efficient processes and reactors, for example;
•  A Hybrid plunging jet stirred tank reactor for G-L/G-L-S systems, 
•  Gas-solid reactor (continuous fluidized bed with pneumatic conveying) and 
•  Gas-solid-plasma reactor (Gliding Arc and Dielectric Barrier Discharge reactor). 

I am looking for a new challenge to utilize my expertise and in-depth technical knowledge to develop CO2 neutral-sustainable chemical process technologies.

profile_positions.description:
•	Nobian is a part of Nouryon chemicals (Est on January 2021) and focuses on the industrial chemicals namely Salt/Chlor Alkali/Chloro-mehtanes/H2 production. 
•	Being a researcher, project leader, and in a central pool of experts to delivered projects in the field of process digitalization (IC4.0); process and unit operation modeling and optimization; development of new technologies and sustainable processes; kinetic/catalytic studies
•	Provides process technology support to various businesses, e.g.: H2 production /MCA/Chloromethanes/ Salt production, of the Nobian Chemicals (Formerly Nouryon/Akzonobel)
•	Expertise in process modeling with Aspen+, Aspen Custom Modeler, VBA, Python, MATLAB
profile_positions.title: Researcher - Process Technology

profile_positions.description: Following acquisition by the Carlyle Group and GIC, Akzonobel Specialty Chemicals continued as Nouryon in October 2018. My role and responsibilites were same as below.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Expert Capability Group, Process Technology - Reactor Engineering

profile_positions.description:
The strategic Research Group Process Technology provided technological support to all the business units of the Akzonobel specialty chemicals. 
My responsibilities included the reaction and reactor modeling, processes and equipment evaluation, process modelling and optimization, development of new technologies and sustainable processes, equipment and production costing.
profile_positions.title: Researcher - II, Strategic Research Group, Process Technology - Reactor Engineering

profile_positions.description:
As a doctoral candidate, worked in the field of reactor and reaction engineering on a European Union funded project "MAPSYN", aiming to use alternative energy (plasma) for efficient nitric oxide and ammonia synthesis. This project was a collaboration between 12 academic and industrial project partners from all over the Europe. 

Following are the highlights of the PhD work;
• My PhD research work paved the path and helped to secure EU research grants to the tune of ~18 MEuro. The follow-up/next generation projects which received EU funding are Project AFRICA, PLASMAPONICS and SCOPE.
• The containerized process plant and technology developed in this PhD research work would be useful for distributed fertilizer and fuel production.
• Achieved the project goal of producing nitric oxide energy efficiently, which guided scaling-up of this process to demonstration unit at Evonik Industries AG, Germany. 
• Developed a novel methodology to combine catalysts with non-thermal plasma reactors to investigate and gain advantages from synergy between plasma and catalyst.
• Planned, communicated and executed various project tasks by working with limited resources, multi-disciplinary and multi-national team.
• Designed, built and tested a pilot scale plasma-catalyst assisted nitrogen fixation processes for nitric oxide and ammonia production at atmospheric pressure.

A digital copy of my PhD thesis can be found here: https://research.tue.nl/en/publications/plasma-catalyst-assisted-nitrogen-fixation-reactor-development-fo
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
During this 2 years postmasters degree, specializing in process and equipment design, I got an opportunity to work in multi-national team on various process design assignments. 

• My second year design assignment on process and reactor development for novel continuous pneumatic reactor for nanoparticle ALD coating and its scale-up played an important role in developing this process later on pilot scale. 
• Also worked on a group design project for Process Design Center, Breda to evaluate and analyzed the conceptual design software “PROSYN” to provide innovative solutions for various industry defined problems.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer- PDEng (Process and Equipment Design)

profile_positions.description: Investigated co-existance of solar thermal plant for chemical industries. My role in the project was to design the heat exchanger network and evaluate heat storage technologies.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
• Gained invaluable experiences from design to operation by working in team to design, install and commission two Bio-ethanol plants (100 KLPD Molasses based Bio-ethanol plant for Birla Sugars, UP and 166 KLPD Grain based Bio-ethanol plant for A.B.Grain Spirit Pvt. Ltd, Punjab), which were successfully executed at client’s site. 
• Created the design documents, which later used as standard template by the process design teams.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer
